comments: Partition of n into parts 3, 4, and 7; see A245368 for the compositions. - _David Neil McGrath_, Sep 08 2014
links: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
F. J. van de Bult, D. C. Gijswijt, J. P. Linderman, N. J. A. Sloane and Allan Wilks, A slow-growing sequence defined by an unusual recurrence, J. Integer Sequences, Vol. 10 (2007), #07.1.2.
Index entries for sequences related to Gijswijt's sequence
example: There are 7 partitions of 27 into parts 3,4 and 7. These are (77733)(774333)(744444)(7443333)(4444443)(44433333)(333333333). - _David Neil McGrath_, Sep 08 2014
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
